summary:
• A breaching whale capsized a boat in Australia, sending two people overboard.
• Retired Australian footballer returns to Olympics after a long break.
• Two men were rescued from the ocean after their boat was flipped by a whale's breach.

• Carbon trading allows companies to profit from the preservation of the Amazon rainforest.
• The industry is often criticized for its potential to contribute to deforestation and environmental degradation.
• Some experts argue that carbon credits can be an effective tool for incentivizing sustainable land use practices.

• Rescuers dig through rubble after deadly landslides hit Ethiopia
• Heavy rainfall triggers devastating floods in Ethiopia's Amhara region
• Death toll rises to over 150 as rescue efforts continue in Ethiopia

• The 1972 Munich Olympics were marred by the killing of Israeli athletes.
• This event still casts a shadow over the upcoming Paris Games.
• The tragedy highlights the ongoing struggle to ensure athlete safety in international competitions.

• Europeans experience thrilling swings in Berlin.
• The high-flying sensation offers breathtaking views.
• Thrill-seekers flock to the unique attraction.

• Netanyahu defends Gaza war amid protests outside US Congress.
• Thousands gather to protest during his Congressional address.
• Netanyahu has a long history of clashes with US Presidents.

• At least twenty-five people died in a shipwreck off the coast of Mauritania.
• The incident occurred on or after January 1st, 2022, but exact date is unknown due to limited reporting.
• Authorities are investigating the cause of the wreck and searching for survivors.

• Morocco defeats Argentina
• Crowd trouble disrupts the match
• Morocco wins despite chaos

• Namibia has started to issue visas to citizens from Western countries.
• The move is seen as a response to the restrictive policies imposed by Western countries on African immigrants.
• This decision aims to promote greater understanding and cooperation between Namibia and its international partners.

• The pilot survives the Nepal crash when the cockpit splits from the plane.
• A Nepal plane crashed at Kathmandu airport, killing 18 people.

• An American reality show contestant kills and consumes a protected bird species in New Zealand.
• The action is considered illegal under New Zealand's wildlife protection laws.
• This incident sparks concern among environmentalists and wildlife enthusiasts about the impact on local ecosystems.

• North Korea dropped balloons carrying trash onto the grounds of South Korea's presidential office.
• The incident occurred near the Blue House, which is the official residence of the South Korean president.
• This act of aggression has sparked tensions between the two nations.

• Typhoon Gaemi makes landfall in Taiwan.
• The typhoon has caused widespread damage to buildings, infrastructure, and transportation systems.
• Emergency services are working to evacuate people from affected areas and provide assistance.

• Drones have opened a new front in the war, threatening to escalate violence.
• The increased use of drones has added complexity to the conflict, making it harder to predict outcomes.
• This development highlights the ongoing brutal nature of the war and its devastating impact on civilians.

• The man who attacked author Salman Rushdie has been charged with supporting the militant group Hezbollah.
• UK royal family members will receive a significant salary increase due to the Crown Estate's record-breaking £1.04 billion profits.
• Author Salman Rushdie was attacked by an assailant; the attacker is now facing charges related to his alleged support of the militant group Hezbollah.

• Joe Biden dropped out of the presidential race to unite his party and the nation.
• A graphic video revealed that U.S. police were positioned near the body of an assassin who targeted Donald Trump at one of his rallies.
• The assassin researched information about John F. Kennedy’s assassination before carrying out his own attack.

• Edmundo González is running against Nicolás Maduro in Venezuela's presidential election
• He is a former opposition leader who has criticized Maduro's government
• González hopes to bring change to the country through his campaign
